website_summaries.verdict: These straps are on the shorter side (8 feet) and have a 200 pounds weight limit.
pros: These straps are low in price and come 2 to a pack
They can be used for securing lighter watercraft (kayaks, canoes) and smaller items like luggage
cons: Owners voice occasional durability concerns, and these straps may be too short for some applications

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This item ripped on the first use, 3 to 4 inches from the buckle. The price I paid was refunded without hassle, and I didn't have to send the item back, but I was fortunate it did not totally fail and cause items to fall off my roof rack while driving.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sette

customer_reviews.title: Sovled my issue and holds strong
customer_reviews.text: I had two couch pieces that, by way of people sitting, would constantly separate. Even with even with pads under the couch legs their would be an annoying separation every 2 or 3 days. So I grabbed this and lashed the legs together and haven't had a single issue since. If these straps can withstand the force of my gamer friends launching their considerably large selves onto my couch...they're are probably gonna hold your stuff together no problem, lol. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Syl Cat

customer_reviews.title: Poor buckle design, and slippage
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the spring for the buckle mechanism interferes with the threading of the strap and rubs into the strap. On other brand lashing straps, the spring is anchored on a separate brace and never comes in contact with the strap itself. The Keeper straps will slip, whether due to the poor buckle design or the teeth on the buckle. These were cheap, but I would have spent more to get better designed straps like those I previously owned. That's the big problem buying online - you can't fully see the product. I recently purchased some NRS straps, which have a far superior design and are easily threaded, unlike the Keepers.
customer_reviews.author: South Pointe Cats

customer_reviews.title: Excellent light duty strap for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used these straps to secure a kayak, and they worked very well. The camlock mechanism seems sturdy and so far the straps don't slip. My only criticism, and it is a minor one, is that it can be a little difficult to thread the strap thru the buckle. Cutting an angle on the end of the strap helps. I liked these straps so well that I bought a second set for a different project.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but a little difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, and will keep items secure. It doesn't not seem like it will easily fray or break. However, it's a bit difficult to thread the strap through the locking clamp, and even when through, you can't just pull it to tighten it. Meaning, it's not even a 1 way tightening clamp, you have to release the clamp and then tighten it. This results in it being not as easy to tighten or not being able to get it as tight as you might want it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. He

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Poor Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: One of the two straps came with a major defect as shown in my photo. Not worth the effort to send it back so I will trash this one. The web strap is very skimpy and wouldn't trust it with any working load over 100 pounds. The metal cam buckle appears cheap as well and will probably break down after medium use.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend for hammocking.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to suspend my hammock. These are way better than the polypropylene straps and Siberian hitch knot I was using before, albeit not as lightweight. The polyester doesn't stretch. We used to hang our hammocks almost entirely flat because of all the give and stretch in the straps - that's not the case with these! I can hang at a true 30-degree angle. At 8 feet long, I can use these around really big trees if I need to. I could have gotten away with 6' lashings but they were more expensive than these. Definitely recommend for hammocking.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues with the latch gripping the strap. I use it to strap down a Lead-Acid Battery on the front of the RV trailer...and it holds it tight and secure. Much better than the crap the RV company provided. I cannot comment on the long-term durability, but it looks well built and seems like it will last several years in the sun and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Willhite

customer_reviews.title: A mediocre strapping kit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple packs of these and am not too crazy about them. Three out of the four I received give a little bit, which means they won't secure anything to a vehicle very well. One gives several inches when strapping something to the roof, so I wouldn't recommend them for anything that requires critical strapping such as items on a luggage rack on your car. I would instead recommend this lashing strap:
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: These little things are great
customer_reviews.text: I did not have high expectations, but these little things are great. They work for sleeping bags, for tying down bikes to a bike rack, whatever you need. Strong and hold well. I bought more after first experimental purchase. Now I have 6 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - No slipping
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. No you won't be able to get them as tight as a ratchet, but you shouldn't expect to. For you people who say that it slips, you might be threading the strap the wrong way. If you thread it correctly, trying to stretch it out will only make the little teeth grab tighter. There is NO WAY, these will slip out once they've been tightened correctly unless you break something.
customer_reviews.author: Who Knows

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to hold a chin up bar in my basement. They work ok for that application. I am looking at the strap and I will know if it slips on the buckell. I would not trust these to hold something I'm not constantly watching. They were inexpensive so the buckell is inexpensive...
customer_reviews.author: Dshow

customer_reviews.title: exceptional for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with how well they are working so far. The spring holds the strap very securely and they feel very strong. I don't think I'll ever exceed their weight limit, so I'm happy. My only half gripe is that the strap is too long and of good enough quality that I resent cutting off the excess, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: GunNut37086

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price
customer_reviews.text: These are decent for the price but they were a little underwhelming and don't have the durable feel like I expected. The strap material is pretty thin and the buckles seem fragile cast pieces. With that said, I have used them now twice on holding down the rear wheels on my motorcycles when towing them on a trailer. They have so far lasted on 300 miles of towing.
customer_reviews.author: Boxman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Yeti!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in place of the Yeti strap offering (Theirs are $45). These work very well and have no issues. I cut to length I needed and burned the ends. Very happy with this product and would recommend to anyone in place of the expensive Yeti straps
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Works great and holds up outdoors
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our outside sunshade to tighten it as the heat and cold makes it contract and relax. It works perfectly and holds up in the elements very well! Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Stays cinched
customer_reviews.text: I used these to lash my sleeping pad and tent to my bicycle for an overnight camping trip, while the metal latch is heavy they are extremely easy to operate and do not budge an inch carrying significant weight over bumpy terrain and long distance. Because of the length of the strap I was also able to attach the two straps to each other and use them to hoist my food up off the ground and away from bears, the latch made a great weight with which to throw the line over a branch. Was impressed with how taught the straps stayed over a long distance and a lot of jostling, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Pfister

customer_reviews.title: These work ok as long as the load isn't super heavy. I have them securing a small portable ...
customer_reviews.text: These work ok as long as the load isn't super heavy. I have them securing a small portable 12v refrigerator in my vehicle and they have to be retightened weekly. The fridge only weights about 35lbs... I wouldn't trust them to hold a motorcycle or anything like that but for small, lightweight loads they do ok.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great to stabilize bike carrier or cargo carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is great with a bike carrier or cargo carrier. (For example,and) I use it with clips ( to help minimize shaking of the bike carrier or cargo carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: fine for what they are
customer_reviews.text: I honestly screwed up, I though these had the usual hooks on them and they don't. So not much use for me as they must be attached to themselves to tighten around whatever...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great, and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: These work great, I only needed about 24inches on the strap. Make sure your feed them through from the right side if you don't want them to slip.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: BEST straps I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: 8 feet is perfect for a 3 foot height or width application. I secured my 7 gallon water container very effectively. I will definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Oooo
customer_reviews.text: They are good back up straps. I used them for my trail cams. Worked great. The length of the strap is a little long, but works.
customer_reviews.author: Wiggly8

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to secure a Portabote to a car roof rack. Fortunately I have not moved the boat and thus not used them for their intended purpose. I did however use them to secure a cabinet to a dolly to move it to my basement. Not only are they very difficult to tighten securely, they slipped and came lose without much effort. Spend a little more $ and get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap grip teeth are better than I expected for the price and due to ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty strong lash strap for my use, securing objects on a 2 wheel dolly. Hasnt slipped at all going up and down stairs with some heavy weight placed on the dolly. Strap grip teeth are better than I expected for the price and due to some of the reviews, Id say this is a pretty solid lash strap. As always dont expect the product to do more than its family is capable of, ratcheting straps for heavy loads.
customer_reviews.author: tem

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to use and very durable. My only problem is sometimes it loosens up by itself. Otherwise it’s good enough for me in tying up and securing moving boxes. Makes the boxes easy to lift and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Vivs

customer_reviews.title: Original packaging!! Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great straps! These look to be great, sturdy quality! I've yet to use them but I have no doubt they'll hold up great! If something changes, I'll come back and update my review! Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Devin R.

customer_reviews.title: Metal, not plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the cheap plastic straps that came with my game camera. These won't break when you crank them down. They help my cameras to the trees and eliminated wobble and sway.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for you money
customer_reviews.text: Use them to secure my bicycles to the bike rack on my car. They get the job done, are easy to use, and made out of durable material.
customer_reviews.author: Juanes

customer_reviews.title: Great Tension Straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on ShopDog sawhorses that I made. They work great and were easy for me to adapt and install.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty strap for lashing many heavy weight items together in a bundle form or as a securing form
customer_reviews.author: The Man

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my backpack
customer_reviews.text: The straps could have been just a tad heavier duty. Using them to hold a jacket to my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Dave4047

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: A good price point, but I personally found the YYZ brand of strap to be a bit better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these to replace straps that secured the awning on my travel trailer. The plastic buckle broke, so I went with these metal buckle straps. They will scratch metal surfaces, so I took a piece of scrap vinyl material, cut a slot, put the strap through the slot, and use it as backing between the buckle and the metal surface. Works very well and the sun will not degrade this metal buckle like it did the plastic buckle.
customer_reviews.author: H. T.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my drawer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the straps to hold my drawer together, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnybeGood

customer_reviews.title: Tie down straps
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to lash down my Engel cooler on my paddle board. I shortened them for my needs and just melted the nylon strap end to keep it from fraying.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: These came in timely and undamaged and i use them to strap my doggie into my bicycle basket; they came complete. What i mean is some straps don't have a clip on them on one end, they are selling some seperately now, but these straps have a metal thinga mingingy on the end , like the belt on an airplane. The strap is sturdy and six feet long...just because. So this could be used a lot of different ways. Good product. Hope this helps/ kimmie
customer_reviews.author: kimmie glannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: These things are a lifesaver. Use them to strap items down where I had previously used a bungy. While they aren't the kind of tie down you would use in place of a ratchet strap, they are great for camping and we use them to tie items down to our snowmobiles in the winter. Great and much less expensive than the store bought ones.
customer_reviews.author: nfinit

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for weight lifting (weighted dips, "chain" type bench presses, etc) and they are holding up fantastic. The clasp provides a tight hold on the strap, which keeps the strap from slipping. I don't use more than 50 lbs of weight with these straps though, so I foresee them lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Youngnstudly

customer_reviews.title: Failed at the worst time.
customer_reviews.text: Only used maybe 3 or 4 times. Usualy to tie a blanket to my motercycle. Traveling at about 65 down the highway they failed. Cant be sure if the strap ripped or the metal snapped. Either way the loose strap got wrapped in my wheel and the metal whipped around making a sizable dent and chipping paint. $500 to fix it because I wanted to save $6 on a real strap. Could of gone way worse for me.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyBear

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: Use them on my tree climber and they work well
customer_reviews.author: Augie C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to tighten and easy to loosen
customer_reviews.text: Held my luggage together very well. Easy to tighten and easy to loosen. It saves a lot of time when you can latch all your luggage together and pull them around like one piece
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, held tight on a 6 hour trip holding down a bike rack
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good light duty strap
customer_reviews.text: Good inexpensive straps. I am using one of these to stabilize the front tire on a bicycle being carried on a trunk mounted bike rack. These are a good strap for me. I cut one of them down to about two feet long and then heated the cut end to seal the strap material so that it doesn't fray and ease of threading it into the (buckle).
customer_reviews.author: Steven B. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Trimmed and installed them and they work...
customer_reviews.text: I've used even longer versions of these for several years and they still have good spring pressure and are quick and easy to install. We use them to hold a computer box shut while we travel in the RV and it performs superbly. What do you say when products just do what they are supposed to without any flourish?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good straps!
customer_reviews.text: These straps have worked well on a pair of collapsing sawhorses I made. Good quality and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Troy C.

customer_reviews.title: Gas tank tie down for outboard motor/ works well
customer_reviews.text: Lasted longer than I thought in a harsh environment. I use these to replace my outbound gas tank strap tie downs. Surprisingly they have lasted and worked well even in occasionally salt water
customer_reviews.author: J. Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this to secure my tooks at work and I love it. It's easy to use and is great quality
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor use seems fine
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these for use on a ladder rack of my van. It gets to be a bit much when you are replacing 6 bungee cords every couple of months. I've only had these about a month but they seem to be holding up well so far. I will update if they begin to fail in the next year
customer_reviews.author: ToeTruck

customer_reviews.title: I recommend keeping a pair of these in every vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly handy straps. They take up very little storage, are easy to deploy and are reasonably tough. I use them to secure all manner of things in my vehicles and most recently used a pair of them to lash 18" lengths of 2x4s to the rear tires on my Suburban. Took about 2 minutes and 30 feet later, I was no longer stuck in the mud.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: not cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: holds a 12 gallon plastic gas tank in place on my boat
customer_reviews.author: James B. Lowell

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Straps are a little thin, as described by other reviews, BUT it is certainly very strong straps good for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nubra

customer_reviews.title: Best for light duty use.
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy as my original straps. Feel lightweight and soft to the touch. They were too short to tie down my kayak to the roof of my car but that is totally my fault for not measuring the original straps. Found another use for them though and am pleased. Took off one star because they appear to be light duty instead of how they were described.
customer_reviews.author: Paso Fino Lover

customer_reviews.title: so inserting it isnt as easy as it should be
customer_reviews.text: Used it to attach bags to the rear of my motorcycle. It slipped, ended up having to tie the free end to limit the amount it slipped. The spring also gets in the way, so inserting it isnt as easy as it should be,
customer_reviews.author: A. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described. Worked as expected. I'm not ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Worked as expected. I'm not using them to do anything high strength. I needed a new heavy duty sleeping bag strap, and to bundle and hold together some other light duty items and these straps are way overkill for that but I knew that going in.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Spolarich

customer_reviews.title: Simple, High Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to use as wheel straps for when I am transporting my bicycles. I have a bike rack that attaches to the tow hitch of my car and the only problem with it is it doesn't keep the bike wheels from spinning and the handlebars from swinging around. Loop these bad boys through the wheels and VOILÀ! problem solved. Simple, high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: nallettoTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: they are holding my boat seats
customer_reviews.text: I bought just to use under Boat seats For more secure Fit
customer_reviews.author: jeffjlake

customer_reviews.title: Strong and locks securely
customer_reviews.text: I used these to strap my oversized load on top of my SUV. I bought 2sets so if the strap is short for my need I can connect 2 end-to-end almost doubling the length. The strap is very rugged and strong for regular top loads...
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo C.

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing it’s get the job done right
customer_reviews.text: It was long so I cut it down to size and it work perfect
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R Russell

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I got these as tie-downs for a cooler rather than spending up for the name-brand ones. These have been working exactly as I'd expect. No issues with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Will. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Quality straps
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality. I used these to help close and keep closed the box I put my Xmas tree in- you know once you get that tree out, it's almost impossible to get back in. But these hold the box closed well and I can use them to lift the box. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia H. Cosimano

customer_reviews.title: Economical choice to strap down your cooler.
customer_reviews.text: I use these to tie down my cooler on the boat, much more economical than the straps the cooler manufacturers sell.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product for use in strapping down kayaks on top of Car. Products function just as expected. Impression of durability, I expect these to last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Perkinson

customer_reviews.title: These lashing straps don't withstand much counter pressure. It ...
customer_reviews.text: These lashing straps don't withstand much counter pressure. It will hold something down so long as it doesn't come up against any adverse conditions. If you need to be 100% positive that whatever your strapping down needs to remain absolutely immovable, keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.C.

customer_reviews.title: The one annoying thing is the end is cut horizontally
customer_reviews.text: Used once so far, and they worked perfectly. Held firm and had a decent amount of friction. The one annoying thing is the end is cut horizontally, so it's hard to get through the clasp. Most ties come with a diagonal cut to assist sticking it through. I'll have to re-cut them sometime.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Helm-Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great straps. Not as beefy as the ones I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great straps. Not as beefy as the ones I use for whitewater kayak strapping but worked great for my travel trailer battery boxes, cut to length and heated ends with a lighter to prevent unraveling.
customer_reviews.author: subeng

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price but the cams will loosen up ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but the cams will loosen up a bit over time especially if you really tighten them up. Make sure you follow the proper threading path or the cam locks wont work at all. There is a diagram on the side of the mechanism to aid you.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in the Big O

customer_reviews.title: Holds Tight in 4 ft Seas
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used one of these straps to hold down my boat battery while out fishing. Recently I've taken my boat out in some heavier seas and the strap held tight. (Traveling as fast as my boat would go in three to four seas) The manufacture provides you with extra length in the thick nylon strap so I had to shorten it for my specific application.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These hardly worked for what I needed it for. I didn't have any confidence that this would hold my kayak on the roof, so I went back to good old ratchet straps. The quality is just ok. I don't feel like those teeth would have held the kayak on very well and i started to noticed some slacking too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Used to hold a car battery in place
customer_reviews.text: Small and strong enough to hold a Jeep Wrangler battery in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got these straps to tie down my battery box ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these straps to tie down my battery box. I only had them on for a week and noticed that the strap had broken. These are not rated for 200 lb working limit if they brake after a week of just holding a battery box in place. I would not trust them to hold/tie anything down with.
customer_reviews.author: James Long

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Use them with a cargo net and are easy to use and secure. Have been left in the elements and show no signs of corrosion or degradation.
customer_reviews.author: HunterB

customer_reviews.title: CRAP - WalMart quality much better for 1/3  of the price
customer_reviews.text: CRAP - the black straps are too thin so they twist while putting them in the clamp - it's honestly like threading a needle. WalMart has 13' straps in blue, material is much thicker.
customer_reviews.author: OroPreto

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to put around trailer wheel covers to prevent them from blowing part ways off which tends to happen with high enough winds. Work great.
customer_reviews.author: campaholic

customer_reviews.title: Straps to secure my bicycle
customer_reviews.text: The work great and are very secure. I use them as a secure backup to the plastic straps that hold our bicycles on the car rack. The work great.
customer_reviews.author: wolferd

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used these for boat battery tie downs. Much better than the plastic end straps that come with battery trays.
customer_reviews.author: Jfu

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace tie-down straps for my car roof carrier. Definitely an upgrade...these straps lock down and stay locked down even at relatively high speeds!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, when I need more length ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, when I need more length I connect them together. Haven't had slipping on the straps yet, so the adjusters do a decent job of holding. Affordable option, easier to secure than the ratcheting version straps.
customer_reviews.author: jpuett

customer_reviews.title: works well, but
customer_reviews.text: The material is a bit too thin to my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Fab.

customer_reviews.title: Great for lashing items to my motorcycle luggage rack.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need to lash items to my Motorcycle
customer_reviews.author: G. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great product and exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that the straps might slip but they held my cooler down perfectly perfectly in rough seas. There was zero slippage with these straps. Great product and exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Spitzerone

customer_reviews.title: Cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: The cam buckle looks cheap. Nothing like an Anchor Strap. Better off getting something from REI.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cranium

customer_reviews.title: Nice for snuggling down stuff
customer_reviews.text: They work well. Not a ratchet strap so make sure it fits your application
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for ease of use. I cut them to custom fit my need and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: great product for us
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for what we needed. We carry 2x6 and 2x4 lumber on our 2013 Honda pilot roof top carrier and always had problems with the tie downs. These straps solved all of our problems. They are easy to use and remove easily. We are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: samuel S.Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing unless you're strapping something super small and won't worry about the item flying away
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing unless you're strapping something super small and won't worry about the item flying away. It barely reached around my compact car and the quality was horrible. I ended up having to buy different/sturdier and longer straps for my car.
customer_reviews.author: JuJu

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We use this to secure the bottom of the volleyball net in our gym. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: DO

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a battery case on our travel trailer, need to trim off excess length for your application and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. We've used these to secure kayaks, tubes, skis, dirtbikes, scooters and who knows what else. The fastener is very quick and easy to use and holds securely.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They do not hold the tension as I hoped they would.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Web material is too lightweight making it difficult to insert through the cam buckle, even after cutting the material end on a diagonal and searing with a flame.
customer_reviews.author: ICamel

customer_reviews.title: Lashing Straps
customer_reviews.text: They do quite a good job of holding stuff together , BUT, if you need to use it for Stuff Which is Moving Around or is affected by a lot of Movement & Vibration, I would suggest going for a Ratcheting Version.
customer_reviews.author: jensen

customer_reviews.title: Spring in the way
customer_reviews.text: If you are accustomed to using NRS straps you will think these are terrible. If you have no idea what an NRS strap is you may be satisfied with these. The spring that keeps the cam shut obstructs the slot where you're supposed to feed the webbing, so it is difficult to feed through every single time you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Psyched

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect them to work when wet.
customer_reviews.text: Used these to attach canoe carts and gear on a 72 mile canoeing trip. After 2 days of rain they constantly had to be re-tightened and would slip easily. If you don't plan on using them outside they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: DWillWest

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Strong Straps
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty straps to hold bags on a motorcycle. They don't slip, perfect width and a bit long. I cut them to my desired length, then singed the end with a lighter. Very well made and absolutely no slippage.
customer_reviews.author: Big-D

customer_reviews.title: HANDY GADGET TO HAVE AROUND THE HOUSE AND CAR
customer_reviews.text: THOUSANDS OF USES, WELL MADE AND GREAT TO KEEP IN ALL YOUR VEHICLES AND THE GARAGE. EASIER TO USE THEN THE RACHET TYPE STRAPS FOR THE SMALLER JOBS.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE W.

customer_reviews.title: Get A Set
customer_reviews.text: Work great! Extra long - cut to fit. Use them to attach a Yeti to my ATV. I leave my cooler on while traveling down the interstate at 70mph and these things hold up well. Do not loosen up on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: @wilmbeach

customer_reviews.title: Work fine. I use them to secure my expensive mountain ...
customer_reviews.text: Work fine. I use them to secure my expensive mountain bike on my bike rack. I had a different pair that seem a little more robust. These are thinner than I expected. With that said though, they work, and the clasp serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Seeman

customer_reviews.title: Tried to save $, but these are not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The cams on these straps are complete garbage. There's no way I would rely on them to hold any load. I returned these and got the NRS version that I know are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Beholdthefield

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy. The eight foot strap can be used for ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the handiest straps. They are sturdy. The eight foot strap can be used for many tasks. I use them to strap storage containers stacked together. I ordered two more sets.
customer_reviews.author: Persistent

product_meta.title: Keeper 85243 8' x 1" Lashing Strap, 2 Pack
product_meta.description: This Keeper lashing strap is typically used for securing canoes and kayaks on the roof rack. This pro grade lashing strap has a 200 lb. working load limit and 600 lb. break strength. Keeper is the expert and leader in branded products and services people trust to ensure their personal property is reliably secured, transported, and stored. These well engineered products are the most trusted to provide unique, simple solutions for specific everyday needs, offering reliability, security, safety, and ease of use.
feature_bullets: Typically used to secure canoes and kayaks
